observations: The grid is mostly filled with zeros.
There are shapes of different numbers formed in the middle of the grid.
The shapes are replaced with the number occupying the largest area of the shape.
hypotheses: Replace each distinct shape with the number occupying the largest area within that shape.
Replace all non-zero numbers with the single most frequent non-zero number in the entire grid.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Replace all non-zero numbers with the single most frequent non-zero number in the entire grid.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In the training examples, this leads to incorrect outputs where distinct shapes are kept with distinct values.

selected_rule: Replace each distinct shape with the number occupying the largest area within that shape.
step_plan: Identify distinct shapes within the grid.
For each shape, count the occurrences of each distinct number.
Replace all cells within the shape with the number with the highest count.
